description: Gets a Databricks network configuration, which represents an AWS VPC and its resources.  This requires a pre-existing VPC and subnets.

network_id.description: Databricks Account API network configuration ID.

\"my-databricks-network\".description: The human-readable name of the network configuration.

vpc_id.description: The ID of the VPC associated with this network configuration. VPC IDs can be used in multiple networks.

UNATTACHED | VALID | BROKEN | WARNED.description: The status of this network configuration object in terms of its use in a workspace:

subnet | securityGroup.description: The AWS resource associated with this warning: a subnet or a security group.

credentials | vpc | subnet | securityGro.description: The AWS resource associated with this error: credentials, VPC, subnet, security group, or network ACL.

1614665312930232.description: Workspace ID associated with this network configuration.

account_id.description: The Databricks account ID associated with this network configuration.

1643668346544.description: Time in epoch milliseconds when the network was created.

rest_api.description: : This is the Databricks-specific ID of the VPC endpoint object in the Account API, not the AWS VPC endpoint ID that you see for your endpoint in the AWS Console.

dataplane_relay.description: : This is the Databricks-specific ID of the VPC endpoint object in the Account API, not the AWS VPC endpoint ID that you see for your endpoint in the AWS Console.

401.description: The request does not have valid authentication credentials for the operation.

404.description: Operation was performed on a resource that does not exist.
